definition: Dai Mingshi (1653-1713), early Qing writer
surname Dai
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

literary inquisition/official persecution of intellectuals for their writing

Gong Zizhen (1792-1841), Chinese man of letters, calligrapher and poet
Yuan Hongdao (1568-1610), Ming dynasty poet and travel writer
Yuan Mei (1716-1798), famous Qing poet and critic, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家

Zhu Xi or Chu Hsi (1130-1200), also known as Master Zhu 朱子, Song dynasty Confucian writer and propagandist, founder of neo-Confucianism
